etymology.description: 人(人) (rén, "man") + 毛(毛) (máo, "hair") + 匕(匕) (bǐ, "cane") = a man with long hair leaning on a cane -> old man
etymology.interpretation: The character 老(lǎo) visually depicts aspects associated with age: a man with long hair and a cane. This combination intuitively suggests the concept of being elderly.

examples.chinese: 他虽然年老(他雖然年老)，但经验丰富(但經驗豐富)。
examples.pinyin: tā suīrán niánlǎo, dàn jīngyàn fēngfù.
examples.english: He may be old, but he is experienced.

examples.chinese: 他是我们班的老老师(他是我們班的老老師)。
examples.pinyin: tā shì wǒmen bān de lǎo lǎoshī.
examples.english: He is our class's venerable teacher.

examples.chinese: 老故事传递智慧(老故事傳遞智慧)。
